div.div: If you would like to receive text message updates regarding delays and cancellations, upcoming events, and academics please text the word “Alert” to 22300.
If you do not get a text response back please call the school office at 419-228-9241.
Spirit Days are now on Fridays. Show your school spirit by wearing red, white, and blue on FRIDAY for only $1.

div.p: Progress Book is the system Heir Force uses to provide parents and students with 24/7 online access to grades and other information such as homework, teacher messages, and school and classroom resources.
Heir Force Community School strives to provide nutritious breakfast and lunch choices for students to fuel their day. Click here to see full menus for breakfast and lunch.
Resources and information for parents to help enhance student success. Click here for access to handbooks, registration information and miscellaneous student forms.
Resources and links to help provide students with supplemental academic resources, and fun links to help students engage in learning.

div.h1:
Shaping Tomorrow’s Leaders
One Child at a Time
div.p: The Heir Force Community School is a newly-developed public school in Lima, Ohio. The Heir Force Community School serves students in kindergarten through eighth grade.

The school focuses on ability-centered, individually guided education. Individual academic goals are set with each student to help every child progress regardless of ability level. In conjunction with low student-teacher ratios, we believe each child’s academic ability can be enhanced. >> Read More

p.span: Reminder that we will be serving ToGo lunches for the week today at Grand Ave. from 11-12:30!
Check out our 3rd video highlighting some of our former students at Heir Force!

As many of you may know by now, per Governor Dewines' directives we will finish out this school year doing school work online. In the coming weeks we will be giving out more information regarding the events that were scheduled in May. We will still have our meal distributions every Monday from 11-12:30 at our Grand Ave location for the rest of this school year for anyone who would like to pick lunches up for their students. Please give us a call if you have any questions. Thanks!
We are very grateful for Councilman Derry Glenn's donation!

p.a: Lima Councilman Derry Glenn organizes a tablet donation for area schools

div.span: Among the countless things affected by COVID-19, a child's education is the most important to 6th Ward Lima Councilman Derry Glenn. He’s helping out by donating tablets and other school
